code: . ├── appliedepidata.Rproj ├── _pkgdown.yml ├── data │   └── newdata.rda (note: internalised) ├── data-raw │   └── newdata.R ├── inst │   └── extdata │       └── tableoftables.xlsx │       └── newdata.xlsx ├── R │   └── newdata_doc.R └── man     └── newdata.Rd

previous_headings: Guide to contributing new datasets > PACKAGE FOLDER STRUCTURE
title: Adding data
text: inst/extdata: Newly added datasets go original filetype, e.g. .xlsx, .csv, also .rds files. files downloaded save_data() function. data-raw: Contains R scripts used processing internalizing datasets (making efficient storage), .e. turning newly added datasets inst/extdata .rda files R: Contains R scripts Roxygen2 format define functions datasets. run creates R documentation files (.Rd files) saved man folder. Multiple datasets can defined one script, sensible grouped together (e.g. part outbreak) vignettes: Contains detailed instructions use particular functions. complement function-level documentation man folder giving broader explanation.

previous_headings: Guide to contributing new datasets > PACKAGE FOLDER STRUCTURE
title: Adding data
text: contain files outputted running code folders . data: Contains internalised processed R datasets (.rda files). created internalizing data (running code data-raw folder), makes efficient file storage. man: Contains R documentation files package functions datasets (created running code R folder). .Rd file information specific function dataset. tests: Contains test files developer use .

title: Adding data
text: describes process adding file repo. Note original datasets need added inst/exta folder, even already .rda format. adding dataset existing R package, can skip step 3 . Name file appropriately . can name whatever want, stick basic naming conventions. B. Ensure already file tableoftables.xlsx named . C. Avoid generic names like: linelist_cleaned.xlsx survey_data.xlsx. D. Use consistent descriptive names without spaces (e.g., AJS_AmTiman, sitrep_mortality_survey). E. Name files group (e.g. outbreak case study) prefix. E.g: examplename_data examplename_population case linelist corresponding denominator table respectively. Place file correct folder . Add inst/extdata folder. downloaded running save_data() function. shapefile, zip first. Build package added data . Press Ctrl + Shift + B build package newly added data. mean data recognized next step. Reproducibly edit dataset internalize (see data-raw/AJS_AmTiman.R example) . console run usethis::use_data_raw("<name file without extension>"). B. creates R script data-raw folder. already contain comment top saying “code prepare  data goes ” usethis::use_data() function internalise dataset (.e. produce rda file) C. Edit R script correctly read file using system.file(), . Necessary edits dataset also go . run script internalise data, close. D. NOTE want process raw data create dataset also accessible users (e.g. via get_data() save_data() functions), make sure processed data also gets saved inst/extdata version 2. Make sure internalise (use_data) versions data. Add dataset tablesoftables.xlsx described . Add documentation dataset added . Create new R script R folder, one file datasets group. file name group name generated tableoftables (column P), suffix ‘_doc’. Note easiest copy edit existing R script folder. B. Ensure clearly document source license dataset. C. Ensure put correct name dataset bottom dataset description (@docType). E.g. examplename_linelist. D. Run devtools::document() create actual R documentation. .Rd file man folder, file name corresponding dataset name (e.g. examplename_linelist.Rd) Add datasets _pkgdown.yml . Subtitle: Describe group linelists. State year brackets language end B. Contents: List datasets. , names correspond name dataset without extension, e.g “examplename_linelist”. C. Make sure correct indentation use dashes. See prior examples file.

title: Adding data
text: table explaining fill variable dataset metadata Excel sheet (tablesoftables.xlsx). guide helps ensure consistency completeness adding new datasets collection. name: filename dataset appears inst/extdata directory, without file extension. unique within dataset group, ideally also within tableoftables (.e. avoid generic names like: linelist_cleaned.xlsx survey_data.xlsx). Use consistent descriptive names without spaces (e.g., AJS_AmTiman, mortality_survey). type: category type dataset (e.g., linelist, population, shape, survey, dictionary). extension: file extension (e.g., xlsx, zip). type_version: Used identify original dataset associated child data. Increment format variables change. multiple linelists one group, increment type. data_version: Used identify original dataset associated child data. Increment format variables change. Ensure document changes appropriate ‘data-raw’ file. language: Language code using ISO 639-1 codes (e.g., en, fr). country: Country code using ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 codes (e.g., tcd). scale: Geographic scale (e.g., subnational, national, international). subject: Main subject dataset (e.g., acute jaundice syndrome). context: Context data (e.g., outbreak, survey). fictional: dataset fictional (yes) real ()? year: Year data collected (e.g., 2016). earliest year dataset (even fictional). description: Brief description dataset. Ideally, copy roxygen documentation. usage: Intended usage (e.g., {sitrep} walkthroughs, training). license: License dataset (e.g., gpl3, mit). group_identifier: EDIT - Created concatinating function excel. High-level identifier combining subject, context, country, year (e.g.,acute_jaundice_syndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016). unique_identifier: EDIT - Combines group_identifier, type, type_version, data_version, context, year create unique identifier (e.g. acute_jaundice_syndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016_linelist_1). example, adding Ebola dataset, enter information shown . original dataset (whether ’s {outbreaks} another source) considered type_version 1. ’s linelist group, remains type_version 1. completely different linelist added (just edited version), increment type_version accordingly. changes data (cleaning changing nums rows columns), increment data_version (e.g., data_version 2), type_version remains indicate ’s derivative (“child”) original. child dataset gets entry. dataset translated different language, create new entry translated version keeping data_version type_version , editing language column accordingly. ensures can trace back parent-child relationship datasets.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Spina (2025). appliedepidata: Datasets used Applied Epi courses resources. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://appliedepi.github.io/appliedepidata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {appliedepidata: Datasets used in Applied Epi courses and resources},   author = {Alexander Spina},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://appliedepi.github.io/appliedepidata/}, }

title: Linelist data from an outbreak of Acute Jaundice Syndrome (AJS) in Chad 2016 — AJS_AmTiman
text: case-linelist contains de-indentified individual level data clinical, laboratory epidemiological information. can used together AJS_AmTiman_population, Blocksshape Quartiersshape. Please note, data adapted order best achieve training objectives. Also, GPS coordinates included dataset correspond real cases identified outbreak. generated exclusively training purposes.

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
text: get_data function designed load specific datasets appliedepidata package based search criteria name, language, group_identifier, unique_identifier. function performs internal lookup identify appropriate dataset(s), loads assigns global environment. Depending type dataset (e.g., regular data frame, spatial data (sf), list), appropriate post-processing done ensure proper handling loading.

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
code: get_data(   name = NULL,   language = NULL,   group_identifier = NULL,   usage = NULL,   unique_identifier = NULL )

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
text: name (optional) string specifying name dataset load. language (optional) string specifying language dataset. used name, group_identifier, unique_identifier, function filter datasets based language. group_identifier (optional) string identifying group related datasets. provided, function return datasets within group unless criteria given. usage (optional) string representing datasets used. provided, function return datasets within group unless criteria given. unique_identifier (optional) string representing unique identifier dataset.

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
text: dataset(s) loaded global environment. Depending structure #' dataset, data frame, spatial object, individual list elements loaded separate objects.

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
text: function operates follows: Dataset Lookup: performs internal lookup identify datasets matching search criteria provided. Loading Datasets: dataset found: attempts load dataset using data() function appliedepidata package. dataset loaded temporary environment avoid global environment clutter loading process. Post-Processing Based Object Type: dataset loaded, function checks type object handles accordingly: Data frames directly assigned global environment without processing. Phylo objects (phylo class) directly assigned global environment without processing. Stars objects (stars class) directly assigned global environment without processing. Epinow objects (epinow class) directly assigned global environment without processing. Spatial objects (sf class) processed using sf::st_as_sf() ensure correct handling spatial data, assigned global environment. Lists data frames split individual objects assigned global environment separate entities. dataset found loaded, function raise error.

title: Retrieve and Load Datasets — get_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load a dataset by name get_data(name = "AJS_AmTiman")  # Load a dataset by name and language get_data(name = "AJS_AmTiman", language = "en")  # Load datasets by group identifier get_data(group_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016")  } # }

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
text: function internal function used within get_data.R save_data.R functions. function helps retrieve information (tableoftables.xlsx) datasets based provided search criteria name, language, group_identifier, unique_identifier. returns dataset matches specified criteria suggests alternatives mismatches found.

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
code: lookup_dataset(   name = NULL,   language = NULL,   group_identifier = NULL,   usage = NULL,   unique_identifier = NULL )

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
text: name (optional) string specifying name dataset search . language (optional) string specifying language dataset. used name, group_identifier, unique_identifier, function filter datasets based language. group_identifier (optional) string identifying group related datasets. provided, function return datasets within group unless criteria given. usage (optional) string representing datasets used. provided, function return datasets within group unless criteria given. unique_identifier (optional) string representing unique identifier dataset.

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
text: data.frame containing dataset information matching dataset found. dataset found multiple datasets found details required (unless group), error message returned suggestions search refinement.

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
text: function performs searches following order: Searching name: single dataset found name, function checks parameters like language group_identifier match dataset. match, suggests alternatives. multiple datasets found, additional filtering done based language group_identifier (specified). Handling incorrect language group_identifier: dataset found name, specified language group_identifier match, alternative datasets suggested based unique_identifier. Searching group_identifier: group_identifier provided, function returns datasets within group unless refinement language necessary. Searching usage: usage provided, function returns datasets within group unless refinement language necessary. Searching unique_identifier: unique_identifier provided, function attempt find dataset identifier apply filtering language name needed.

title: Lookup Dataset Information — lookup_dataset
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Search by name lookup_dataset(name = "AJS_AmTiman")  # Search by name and language lookup_dataset(name = "AJS_AmTiman", language = "en")  # Search by group identifier and language lookup_dataset(group_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016", language = "fr")  # Search by unique identifier lookup_dataset(unique_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016_linelist_1_1_outbreak_2016")  # Search by name and group identifier lookup_dataset(name = "AJS_AmTiman", group_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016") } # }

what: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
text: save_data function saves dataset files (unzips necessary) based search criteria dataset name, language, group_identifier, unique_identifier. checks existence required files, files exist, either copied unzipped specified directory.

title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
code: save_data(   name = NULL,   language = NULL,   group_identifier = NULL,   usage = NULL,   unique_identifier = NULL,   path = rstudioapi::selectDirectory() )

title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
text: name (optional) string specifying name dataset save. language (optional) string specifying language dataset. used name, group_identifier, unique_identifier, function filter datasets based language. group_identifier (optional) string identifying group related datasets. provided, function return datasets within group unless criteria given. usage (optional) string representing datasets used. provided, function return datasets within group unless criteria given. unique_identifier (optional) string representing unique identifier dataset. path (optional) string specifying directory dataset files saved. provided, function prompt user select directory via rstudioapi::selectDirectory() function.

title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
text: return value. function saves specified dataset files chosen directory. success failure message printed upon completion.

title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
text: function assumes dataset files available "extdata" directory appliedepidata package. function follows steps: Dataset Lookup: looks dataset information using lookup_dataset based provided search criteria (name, language, group_identifier, usage unique_identifier). File Existence Check: checks required dataset files exist using list_data function. files missing, error message lists . File Copying Unzipping: files found, function copies files specified directory. files zipped (.zip), unzipped saved.

title: Save Data Files to a Specified Directory — save_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Save a dataset by name to a chosen directory save_data(name = "AJS_AmTiman", path = "/path/to/save/directory")  # Save a dataset by group identifier and language save_data(group_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016", language = "fr")  # Save a dataset by unique identifier save_data(unique_identifier = "acutejaundicesyndrome_outbreak_tcd_2016_linelist_1_1_outbreak_2016") } # }

title: Linelist for fictionalized salmonella outbreak in Stegen, Germany — stegentira_data
text: case study first designed Alain Moren Gilles Desve EPIET. based investigation conducted Anja Hauri, RKI, Berlin, 1998. Data fictional inspired Nygren et al. Tick-borne encephalitis: acute clinical manifestations severity 581 cases Germany, 2018-2020. Journal Infection. 2023 Apr 1;86(4):369-75 version 1.0 (appliedepidata package. Earlier data versions used EPIET considered) dataset English. dataset licensed GPL3

Also, like European standard population, World standard population equal numbers males females within age band. However, World standard population ‘young’ population, generally less appropriate Scottish data European standard population used particular purposes. file split five year age groups sex
